news_header: Alexei Moskalev, detained in Russia after his daughter drew an anti-war picture, has been released from a penal colony after serving time for discrediting the army.
news_text: Alexei Moskalev was detained in Russia after his daughter Masha drew an anti-war picture in 2022, which led to his arrest for criticizing the Russian army. He was sentenced to two years in jail in March 2023 and spent time in harsh conditions. After his release, he embraced his daughter, who had been placed in a children's home. The case highlights the deteriorating human rights situation in Russia, particularly regarding freedom of expression since the invasion of Ukraine.
